description: If m = p_i^e_i, n=Prod p_j^f_j, set G_m(n) = Prod p_{j+i}^{f_j*e_i}; extend G_m to all m by multiplicativity; sequence gives a(n)=G_n(n).
comments: m is a prime power iff a(m) is a prime power: A010055(a(A000961(n))) = 1 and A010055(a(A024619(n))) = 0. [_Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 16 2012]
references: From a puzzle proposed by _Marc LeBrun_.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
prog: (Haskell)a045974 n = g n n where   g x y = product [a000040 (a049084 pi + a049084 pj) ^ (ei * ej) |                    (pi,ei) <- zip (a027748_row x) (a124010_row x),                    (pj,ej) <- zip (a027748_row y) (a124010_row y)]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 16 2012
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
